+ - [ ] Update &#96;package.json&#96; versions

+ # Codex Agent Completion Sound Player
+ # Plays Marisa&#39;s &quot;Owattaze!&quot; sound
+ 
+ $soundPath = &quot;C:\Users\downl\Desktop\SO8T\.cursor\marisa_owattaze.wav&quot;
+ 
+ if (Test-Path $soundPath) {
+     Write-Host &quot;Playing completion sound...&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     
+     # Use Windows Media Player COM object for better compatibility
+     $player = New-Object System.Media.SoundPlayer $soundPath
+     $player.PlaySync()
+     
+     Write-Host &quot;Sound playback completed!&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ } else {
+     Write-Host &quot;Warning: Sound file not found at: $soundPath&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     Write-Host &quot;Playing beep sounds instead...&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     [Console]::Beep(800, 300)
+     [Console]::Beep(1000, 300)
+     [Console]::Beep(1200, 500)
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,105 @@
- 
+ /*!
+  * Codex OS-Resident Daemon
+  * 
+  * Features:
+  * - Kernel-level integration
+  * - Auto-start on boot
+  * - Cross-platform (Windows/Linux/macOS)
+  * - GPU-aware scheduling
+  * - System-wide AI optimization
+  */
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use std::sync::Arc;
+ use tokio::sync::RwLock;
+ use tracing::{info, warn, error};
+ 
+ mod config;
+ mod kernel;
+ mod service;
+ 
+ use config::DaemonConfig;
+ use kernel::KernelInterface;
+ 
+ /// Daemon global state
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ pub struct DaemonState {
+     config: DaemonConfig,
+     kernel: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;KernelInterface&gt;&gt;,
+     running: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;bool&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl DaemonState {
+     pub fn new(config: DaemonConfig) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         Ok(Self {
+             kernel: Arc::new(RwLock::new(KernelInterface::new()?)),
+             config,
+             running: Arc::new(RwLock::new(false)),
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     pub async fn start(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         info!(&quot;ğŸš€ Starting Codex Daemon v1.0.0&quot;);
+ 
+         // Set running flag
+         *self.running.write().await = true;
+ 
+         // Initialize kernel interface
+         let mut kernel = self.kernel.write().await;
+         kernel.init().context(&quot;Failed to initialize kernel interface&quot;)?;
+         
+         info!(&quot;âœ… Kernel interface initialized&quot;);
+         info!(&quot;ğŸ“Š Monitoring system events...&quot;);
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     pub async fn stop(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         info!(&quot;ğŸ›‘ Stopping Codex Daemon&quot;);
+ 
+         *self.running.write().await = false;
+ 
+         let mut kernel = self.kernel.write().await;
+         kernel.cleanup()?;
+ 
+         info!(&quot;âœ… Daemon stopped gracefully&quot;);
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     pub async fn is_running(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
+         *self.running.read().await
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[tokio::main]
+ async fn main() -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     // Initialize tracing
+     tracing_subscriber::fmt()
+         .with_env_filter(&quot;codex_daemon=info&quot;)
+         .init();
+ 
+     // Load configuration
+     let config = DaemonConfig::load()?;
+ 
+     // Create daemon state
+     let state = Arc::new(DaemonState::new(config)?);
+ 
+     #[cfg(windows)]
+     {
+         service::windows::run_service(state)?;
+     }
+ 
+     #[cfg(target_os = &quot;linux&quot;)]
+     {
+         service::linux::run_daemon(state).await?;
+     }
+ 
+     #[cfg(target_os = &quot;macos&quot;)]
+     {
+         service::macos::run_launchd(state).await?;
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
```

+ /*!
+  * Linux kernel module interface
+  */
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result, bail};
+ use std::process::Command;
+ use std::path::Path;
+ use tracing::{info, warn, error};
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ pub struct LinuxKernel {
+     ai_scheduler_loaded: bool,
+     ai_mem_loaded: bool,
+ }
+ 
+ impl LinuxKernel {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         Ok(Self {
+             ai_scheduler_loaded: false,
+             ai_mem_loaded: false,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Load kernel modules
+     pub fn load_modules(&amp;mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         info!(&quot;Loading Linux kernel modules&quot;);
+ 
+         // Check if running as root
+         if !Self::is_root() {
+             bail!(&quot;Kernel module loading requires root privileges&quot;);
+         }
+ 
+         // Load AI Scheduler
+         if let Err(e) = self.load_module(&quot;ai_scheduler&quot;) {
+             warn!(&quot;Failed to load ai_scheduler: {}&quot;, e);
+         } else {
+             self.ai_scheduler_loaded = true;
+             info!(&quot;âœ… ai_scheduler loaded&quot;);
+         }
+ 
+         // Load AI Memory
+         if let Err(e) = self.load_module(&quot;ai_mem&quot;) {
+             warn!(&quot;Failed to load ai_mem: {}&quot;, e);
+         } else {
+             self.ai_mem_loaded = true;
+             info!(&quot;âœ… ai_mem loaded&quot;);
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Unload kernel modules
+     pub fn unload_modules(&amp;mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         info!(&quot;Unloading Linux kernel modules&quot;);
+ 
+         if self.ai_mem_loaded {
+             if let Err(e) = self.unload_module(&quot;ai_mem&quot;) {
+                 warn!(&quot;Failed to unload ai_mem: {}&quot;, e);
+             } else {
+                 self.ai_mem_loaded = false;
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         if self.ai_scheduler_loaded {
+             if let Err(e) = self.unload_module(&quot;ai_scheduler&quot;) {
+                 warn!(&quot;Failed to unload ai_scheduler: {}&quot;, e);
+             } else {
+                 self.ai_scheduler_loaded = false;
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Load a single kernel module
+     fn load_module(&amp;self, name: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         // Try modprobe first (standard way)
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;modprobe&quot;)
+             .arg(name)
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to execute modprobe&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             // Try insmod with explicit path
+             let module_path = format!(&quot;/lib/modules/codex/{}.ko&quot;, name);
+             if Path::new(&amp;module_path).exists() {
+                 let output = Command::new(&quot;insmod&quot;)
+                     .arg(&amp;module_path)
+                     .output()
+                     .context(&quot;Failed to execute insmod&quot;)?;
+ 
+                 if !output.status.success() {
+                     bail!(&quot;insmod failed: {}&quot;, String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr));
+                 }
+             } else {
+                 bail!(&quot;Module not found: {}&quot;, module_path);
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Unload a single kernel module
+     fn unload_module(&amp;self, name: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let output = Command::new(&quot;rmmod&quot;)
+             .arg(name)
+             .output()
+             .context(&quot;Failed to execute rmmod&quot;)?;
+ 
+         if !output.status.success() {
+             bail!(&quot;rmmod failed: {}&quot;, String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr));
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Check if running as root
+     fn is_root() -&gt; bool {
+         unsafe { libc::geteuid() == 0 }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Check if kernel integration is available
+     pub fn is_available() -&gt; bool {
+         // Check if kernel modules exist
+         Path::new(&quot;/lib/modules/codex/ai_scheduler.ko&quot;).exists() ||
+         Path::new(&quot;/lib/modules/codex/ai_mem.ko&quot;).exists()
+     }
+ 
+     /// Read kernel module statistics
+     pub fn get_stats(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;KernelStats&gt; {
+         let mut stats = KernelStats::default();
+ 
+         // Read from /proc filesystem
+         if let Ok(scheduler_stats) = std::fs::read_to_string(&quot;/proc/ai_scheduler&quot;) {
+             stats.scheduler_active = true;
+             stats.ai_tasks = Self::parse_task_count(&amp;scheduler_stats);
+         }
+ 
+         if let Ok(mem_stats) = std::fs::read_to_string(&quot;/proc/ai_memory&quot;) {
+             stats.memory_pool_active = true;
+             stats.allocated_mb = Self::parse_allocated_mem(&amp;mem_stats);
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(stats)
+     }
+ 
+     fn parse_task_count(proc_content: &amp;str) -&gt; u32 {
+         proc_content
+             .lines()
+             .find(|line| line.starts_with(&quot;AI Tasks:&quot;))
+             .and_then(|line| line.split(&#39;:&#39;).nth(1))
+             .and_then(|count| count.trim().parse().ok())
+             .unwrap_or(0)
+     }
+ 
+     fn parse_allocated_mem(proc_content: &amp;str) -&gt; u32 {
+         proc_content
+             .lines()
+             .find(|line| line.starts_with(&quot;Allocated:&quot;))
+             .and_then(|line| line.split(&#39;:&#39;).nth(1))
+             .and_then(|mem| mem.trim().split_whitespace().next())
+             .and_then(|mem| mem.parse().ok())
+             .unwrap_or(0)
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Default)]
+ pub struct KernelStats {
+     pub scheduler_active: bool,
+     pub memory_pool_active: bool,
+     pub ai_tasks: u32,
+     pub allocated_mb: u32,
+ }
+ 
```

+ /*!
+  * Windows kernel driver interface
+  */
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result, bail};
+ use std::path::Path;
+ use tracing::{info, warn};
+ use winapi::um::winsvc::*;
+ use winapi::shared::winerror::*;
+ use std::ptr;
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ pub struct WindowsKernel {
+     driver_loaded: bool,
+     scm_handle: Option&lt;winapi::um::winsvc::SC_HANDLE&gt;,
+     service_handle: Option&lt;winapi::um::winsvc::SC_HANDLE&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl WindowsKernel {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         Ok(Self {
+             driver_loaded: false,
+             scm_handle: None,
+             service_handle: None,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Load kernel driver
+     pub fn load_driver(&amp;mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         info!(&quot;Loading Windows kernel driver&quot;);
+ 
+         // Check if running as Administrator
+         if !Self::is_administrator() {
+             bail!(&quot;Driver loading requires Administrator privileges&quot;);
+         }
+ 
+         unsafe {
+             // Open Service Control Manager
+             let scm = OpenSCManagerW(
+                 ptr::null(),
+                 ptr::null(),
+                 SC_MANAGER_ALL_ACCESS
+             );
+ 
+             if scm.is_null() {
+                 bail!(&quot;Failed to open Service Control Manager&quot;);
+             }
+ 
+             self.scm_handle = Some(scm);
+ 
+             // Open or create service
+             let service_name = to_wide_string(&quot;CodexAiDriver&quot;);
+             let driver_path = to_wide_string(r&quot;C:\Windows\System32\drivers\codex_ai.sys&quot;);
+ 
+             let service = OpenServiceW(
+                 scm,
+                 service_name.as_ptr(),
+                 SERVICE_ALL_ACCESS
+             );
+ 
+             let service = if service.is_null() {
+                 // Create service
+                 CreateServiceW(
+                     scm,
+                     service_name.as_ptr(),
+                     service_name.as_ptr(),
+                     SERVICE_ALL_ACCESS,
+                     SERVICE_KERNEL_DRIVER,
+                     SERVICE_DEMAND_START,
+                     SERVICE_ERROR_NORMAL,
+                     driver_path.as_ptr(),
+                     ptr::null(),
+                     ptr::null_mut(),
+                     ptr::null(),
+                     ptr::null(),
+                     ptr::null()
+                 )
+             } else {
+                 service
+             };
+ 
+             if service.is_null() {
+                 CloseServiceHandle(scm);
+                 bail!(&quot;Failed to open/create driver service&quot;);
+             }
+ 
+             self.service_handle = Some(service);
+ 
+             // Start service
+             if StartServiceW(service, 0, ptr::null_mut()) != 0 {
+                 self.driver_loaded = true;
+                 info!(&quot;âœ… Codex AI driver loaded&quot;);
+             } else {
+                 let error = winapi::um::errhandlingapi::GetLastError();
+                 if error == ERROR_SERVICE_ALREADY_RUNNING {
+                     self.driver_loaded = true;
+                     info!(&quot;âœ… Codex AI driver already running&quot;);
+                 } else {
+                     warn!(&quot;Failed to start driver service: error code {}&quot;, error);
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Unload kernel driver
+     pub fn unload_driver(&amp;mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         info!(&quot;Unloading Windows kernel driver&quot;);
+ 
+         unsafe {
+             if let Some(service) = self.service_handle {
+                 let mut status: SERVICE_STATUS = std::mem::zeroed();
+                 ControlService(service, SERVICE_CONTROL_STOP, &amp;mut status);
+                 CloseServiceHandle(service);
+                 self.service_handle = None;
+             }
+ 
+             if let Some(scm) = self.scm_handle {
+                 CloseServiceHandle(scm);
+                 self.scm_handle = None;
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         self.driver_loaded = false;
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ 
+     /// Check if running as Administrator
+     fn is_administrator() -&gt; bool {
+         use winapi::um::securitybaseapi::*;
+         use winapi::um::winnt::*;
+ 
+         unsafe {
+             let mut is_admin = 0i32;
+             let mut sid: PSID = ptr::null_mut();
+             let mut sid_authority = SID_IDENTIFIER_AUTHORITY {
+                 Value: [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 5],
+             };
+ 
+             if AllocateAndInitializeSid(
+                 &amp;mut sid_authority,
+                 2,
+                 SECURITY_BUILTIN_DOMAIN_RID,
+                 DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_ADMINS,
+                 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0,
+                 &amp;mut sid
+             ) != 0 {
+                 CheckTokenMembership(ptr::null_mut(), sid, &amp;mut is_admin);
+                 FreeSid(sid);
+             }
+ 
+             is_admin != 0
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Check if driver is available
+     pub fn is_available() -&gt; bool {
+         Path::new(r&quot;C:\Windows\System32\drivers\codex_ai.sys&quot;).exists()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Drop for WindowsKernel {
+     fn drop(&amp;mut self) {
+         let _ = self.unload_driver();
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ fn to_wide_string(s: &amp;str) -&gt; Vec&lt;u16&gt; {
+     use std::ffi::OsStr;
+     use std::os::windows::ffi::OsStrExt;
+     OsStr::new(s).encode_wide().chain(Some(0)).collect()
+ }
+ 
```

+ /*!
+  * Linux systemd service implementation

+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use std::sync::Arc;
+ use tokio::signal;
+ use tracing::{info, error};
+ 
+ use crate::DaemonState;
+ 
+ /// Run as systemd daemon
+ pub async fn run_daemon(state: Arc&lt;DaemonState&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     info!(&quot;Starting Codex daemon (systemd mode)&quot;);
+ 
+     // Start the daemon
+     state.start().await?;
+ 
+     // Install signal handlers
+     let state_clone = state.clone();
+     tokio::spawn(async move {
+         match signal::ctrl_c().await {
+             Ok(()) =&gt; {
+                 info!(&quot;Received SIGINT, shutting down...&quot;);
+                 if let Err(e) = state_clone.stop().await {
+                     error!(&quot;Error during shutdown: {}&quot;, e);
+                 }
+                 std::process::exit(0);
+             }
+             Err(e) =&gt; {
+                 error!(&quot;Failed to listen for SIGINT: {}&quot;, e);
+             }
+         }
+     });
+ 
+     // Main loop
+     while state.is_running().await {
+         tokio::time::sleep(tokio::time::Duration::from_secs(1)).await;
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }

+     info!(&quot;Installing systemd service&quot;);
+

+ Description=Codex AI Daemon
+ Documentation=https://github.com/zapabob/codex
+ After=network.target
+ 
+ [Service]
+ Type=simple
+ ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/codex-daemon
+ Restart=always
+ RestartSec=10
+ User=root
+ Group=root
+

+ NoNewPrivileges=false

+ ProtectHome=true

+ /*!
+  * Windows Service implementation
+  */
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use std::ffi::OsString;
+ use std::sync::Arc;
+ use std::time::Duration;
+ use windows_service::{
+     define_windows_service,
+     service::{
+         ServiceControl, ServiceControlAccept, ServiceExitCode, ServiceState, ServiceStatus,
+         ServiceType,
+     },
+     service_control_handler::{self, ServiceControlHandlerResult},
+     service_dispatcher,
+ };
+ use tracing::{info, error};
+ 
+ use crate::DaemonState;
+ 
+ const SERVICE_NAME: &amp;str = &quot;CodexDaemon&quot;;
+ const SERVICE_TYPE: ServiceType = ServiceType::OWN_PROCESS;
+ 
+ define_windows_service!(ffi_service_main, service_main);
+ 
+ /// Run as Windows Service
+ pub fn run_service(state: Arc&lt;DaemonState&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     info!(&quot;Starting Codex daemon (Windows Service mode)&quot;);
+ 
+     service_dispatcher::start(SERVICE_NAME, ffi_service_main)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to start service dispatcher&quot;)?;
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn service_main(arguments: Vec&lt;OsString&gt;) {
+     if let Err(e) = run_service_impl(arguments) {
+         error!(&quot;Service error: {}&quot;, e);
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ fn run_service_impl(_arguments: Vec&lt;OsString&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let (shutdown_tx, mut shutdown_rx) = tokio::sync::mpsc::channel(1);
+ 
+     // Define service control handler
+     let event_handler = move |control_event| -&gt; ServiceControlHandlerResult {
+         match control_event {
+             ServiceControl::Stop | ServiceControl::Interrogate =&gt; {
+                 let _ = shutdown_tx.try_send(());
+                 ServiceControlHandlerResult::NoError
+             }
+             _ =&gt; ServiceControlHandlerResult::NotImplemented,
+         }
+     };
+ 
+     // Register service control handler
+     let status_handle = service_control_handler::register(SERVICE_NAME, event_handler)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to register service control handler&quot;)?;
+ 
+     // Tell Windows we&#39;re starting
+     status_handle.set_service_status(ServiceStatus {
+         service_type: SERVICE_TYPE,
+         current_state: ServiceState::StartPending,
+         controls_accepted: ServiceControlAccept::empty(),
+         exit_code: ServiceExitCode::Win32(0),
+         checkpoint: 0,
+         wait_hint: Duration::default(),
+         process_id: None,
+     })?;
+ 
+     // Create runtime
+     let runtime = tokio::runtime::Runtime::new()
+         .context(&quot;Failed to create Tokio runtime&quot;)?;
+ 
+     runtime.block_on(async {
+         // Load config and create state
+         let config = crate::config::DaemonConfig::load()?;
+         let state = Arc::new(crate::DaemonState::new(config)?);
+ 
+         // Start daemon
+         state.start().await?;
+ 
+         // Tell Windows we&#39;re running
+         status_handle.set_service_status(ServiceStatus {
+             service_type: SERVICE_TYPE,
+             current_state: ServiceState::Running,
+             controls_accepted: ServiceControlAccept::STOP,
+             exit_code: ServiceExitCode::Win32(0),
+             checkpoint: 0,
+             wait_hint: Duration::default(),
+             process_id: None,
+         })?;
+ 
+         info!(&quot;âœ… Service is now running&quot;);
+ 
+         // Wait for shutdown signal
+         shutdown_rx.recv().await;
+ 
+         // Tell Windows we&#39;re stopping
+         status_handle.set_service_status(ServiceStatus {
+             service_type: SERVICE_TYPE,
+             current_state: ServiceState::StopPending,
+             controls_accepted: ServiceControlAccept::empty(),
+             exit_code: ServiceExitCode::Win32(0),
+             checkpoint: 0,
+             wait_hint: Duration::from_secs(5),
+             process_id: None,
+         })?;
+ 
+         // Stop daemon
+         state.stop().await?;
+ 
+         // Tell Windows we&#39;re stopped
+         status_handle.set_service_status(ServiceStatus {
+             service_type: SERVICE_TYPE,
+             current_state: ServiceState::Stopped,
+             controls_accepted: ServiceControlAccept::empty(),
+             exit_code: ServiceExitCode::Win32(0),
+             checkpoint: 0,
+             wait_hint: Duration::default(),
+             process_id: None,
+         })?;
+ 
+         Ok::&lt;(), anyhow::Error&gt;(())
+     })?;
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ /// Install Windows Service
+ pub fn install_service() -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     use std::process::Command;
+ 
+     info!(&quot;Installing Windows Service&quot;);
+ 
+     let exe_path = std::env::current_exe()
+         .context(&quot;Failed to get current exe path&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let output = Command::new(&quot;sc&quot;)
+         .args(&amp;[
+             &quot;create&quot;,
+             SERVICE_NAME,
+             &quot;binPath=&quot;,
+             &amp;exe_path.to_string_lossy(),
+             &quot;start=&quot;,
+             &quot;auto&quot;,
+             &quot;DisplayName=&quot;,
+             &quot;Codex AI Daemon&quot;,
+         ])
+         .output()
+         .context(&quot;Failed to execute sc command&quot;)?;
+ 
+     if !output.status.success() {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;Failed to create service: {}&quot;, String::from_utf8_lossy(&amp;output.stderr));
+     }
+ 
+     info!(&quot;âœ… Windows Service installed&quot;);
+     info!(&quot;Run &#39;sc start {}&#39; to start the service&quot;, SERVICE_NAME);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
```

- 
+ # Security Considerations for Codex Daemon
+ 
+ **Version**: 1.0.0  
+ **Last Updated**: 2025-11-02
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”’ Overview
+ 
+ Codex Daemon runs with elevated privileges and integrates with the OS kernel. This document outlines security considerations and best practices.
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## âš ï¸ Security Risks
+ 
+ ### 1. Kernel-Level Access
+ 
+ **Risk**: Kernel modules/drivers can compromise entire system
+ 
+ **Mitigation**:
+ - Code review for all kernel code
+ - Extensive testing in VM environments
+ - Memory safety (use Rust where possible)
+ - Bounds checking on all inputs
+ - Signed drivers (Windows production)
+ 
+ ### 2. Privilege Escalation
+ 
+ **Risk**: Daemon runs as root/Administrator
+ 
+ **Mitigation**:
+ - Drop privileges after initialization (where possible)
+ - Use Linux capabilities instead of full root
+ - SELinux/AppArmor policies
+ - Minimal capability set (CAP_SYS_ADMIN, CAP_SYS_MODULE only)
+ 
+ ### 3. Code Injection
+ 
+ **Risk**: Malicious code loading into kernel space
+ 
+ **Mitigation**:
+ - Verify module signatures
+ - Cryptographic hashes for modules
+ - Secure boot integration
+ - Module loading restrictions (kernel lockdown)
+ 
+ ### 4. Resource Exhaustion
+ 
+ **Risk**: DoS through memory/CPU abuse
+ 
+ **Mitigation**:
+ - Memory pool size limits (256MB default)
+ - Rate limiting on kernel calls
+ - Resource monitors
+ - Automatic recovery mechanisms
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ›¡ï¸ Security Features
+ 
+ ### Linux
+ 
+ #### Capabilities
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;ini
+ [Service]
+ # Only required capabilities
+ AmbientCapabilities=CAP_SYS_ADMIN CAP_SYS_MODULE
+ 
+ # Prevent new privileges
+ NoNewPrivileges=false
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### SELinux Policy
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ # codex_daemon.te
+ policy_module(codex_daemon, 1.0.0)
+ 
+ type codex_daemon_t;
+ type codex_daemon_exec_t;
+ init_daemon_domain(codex_daemon_t, codex_daemon_exec_t)
+ 
+ # Allow module loading
+ allow codex_daemon_t self:capability { sys_admin sys_module };
+ 
+ # Allow /proc access
+ allow codex_daemon_t proc_t:file { read write };
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### AppArmor Profile
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ # /etc/apparmor.d/usr.local.bin.codex-daemon
+ #include &lt;tunables/global&gt;
+ 
+ /usr/local/bin/codex-daemon {
+   #include &lt;abstractions/base&gt;
+   
+   capability sys_admin,
+   capability sys_module,
+   
+   /proc/ai_scheduler r,
+   /proc/ai_memory rw,
+   
+   /sys/module/ r,
+   /lib/modules/codex/*.ko r,
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Windows
+ 
+ #### Service Account
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ # Create restricted service account
+ $ServiceAccount = &quot;NT SERVICE\CodexDaemon&quot;
+ 
+ # Set ACLs
+ icacls &quot;C:\Program Files\Codex&quot; /grant &quot;${ServiceAccount}:(OI)(CI)RX&quot;
+ icacls &quot;C:\ProgramData\Codex&quot; /grant &quot;${ServiceAccount}:(OI)(CI)F&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Driver Signing
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ # Sign driver for production (requires valid certificate)
+ SignTool sign /v /s &quot;My&quot; /n &quot;Codex&quot; /t http://timestamp.digicert.com C:\Windows\System32\drivers\codex_ai.sys
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ” Configuration Security
+ 
+ ### Secure Defaults
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;toml
+ # daemon.toml
+ kernel_integration = false  # Disable by default
+ gpu_optimization = true
+ memory_pool_size_mb = 256   # Reasonable limit
+ 
+ # Restrict logging
+ log_level = &quot;warn&quot;  # Avoid verbose logging in production
+ 
+ # Audit trail
+ audit_enabled = true
+ audit_log_path = &quot;/var/log/codex/audit.log&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### File Permissions
+ 
+ **Linux**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Config file
+ sudo chmod 600 /etc/codex/daemon.toml
+ sudo chown root:root /etc/codex/daemon.toml
+ 
+ # Binary
+ sudo chmod 755 /usr/local/bin/codex-daemon
+ sudo chown root:root /usr/local/bin/codex-daemon
+ 
+ # Kernel modules
+ sudo chmod 644 /lib/modules/codex/*.ko
+ sudo chown root:root /lib/modules/codex/*.ko
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Windows**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ # Config file
+ icacls &quot;C:\ProgramData\Codex\daemon.toml&quot; /inheritance:r /grant:r &quot;SYSTEM:(F)&quot; &quot;Administrators:(F)&quot;
+ 
+ # Driver
+ icacls &quot;C:\Windows\System32\drivers\codex_ai.sys&quot; /inheritance:r /grant:r &quot;SYSTEM:(R)&quot; &quot;Administrators:(F)&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“Š Audit &amp; Monitoring
+ 
+ ### Logging
+ 
+ **Critical events to log**:
+ - Service start/stop
+ - Kernel module load/unload
+ - Configuration changes
+ - Authentication attempts
+ - Errors and exceptions
+ 
+ **Example**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ use tracing::{info, warn, error};
+ 
+ info!(
+     action = &quot;kernel_module_load&quot;,
+     module = &quot;ai_scheduler&quot;,
+     user = &quot;root&quot;,
+     &quot;Kernel module loaded successfully&quot;
+ );
+ 
+ warn!(
+     action = &quot;config_change&quot;,
+     parameter = &quot;memory_pool_size_mb&quot;,
+     old_value = 256,
+     new_value = 512,
+     &quot;Configuration changed - restart required&quot;
+ );
+ 
+ error!(
+     action = &quot;kernel_module_failure&quot;,
+     module = &quot;ai_mem&quot;,
+     error = ?e,
+     &quot;Failed to load kernel module&quot;
+ );
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Metrics
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Prometheus metrics
+ lazy_static! {
+     static ref KERNEL_MODULE_LOADS: Counter = 
+         Counter::new(&quot;codex_kernel_module_loads_total&quot;, &quot;Total kernel module loads&quot;).unwrap();
+     
+     static ref MEMORY_POOL_USAGE: Gauge = 
+         Gauge::new(&quot;codex_memory_pool_bytes&quot;, &quot;Memory pool usage in bytes&quot;).unwrap();
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸš¨ Incident Response
+ 
+ ### Kernel Panic
+ 
+ **Detection**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Monitor kernel logs
+ sudo journalctl -k -f | grep -i panic
+ 
+ # Check crash dumps
+ ls -lh /var/crash/
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Response**:
+ 1. Reboot to recovery mode
+ 2. Unload problematic module
+ 3. Review kernel logs
+ 4. Report bug with crash dump
+ 
+ ### Security Breach
+ 
+ **Detection**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Check for unauthorized module loads
+ sudo lsmod | grep -v &quot;ai_scheduler\|ai_mem&quot;
+ 
+ # Audit logs
+ sudo ausearch -m KERNEL_MODULE
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Response**:
+ 1. Stop daemon immediately
+ 2. Unload all modules
+ 3. Review audit logs
+ 4. Investigate root cause
+ 5. Apply patches
+ 6. Restart with monitoring
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## âœ… Security Checklist
+ 
+ ### Before Deployment
+

+ ### 1. OSå¸¸é§Daemonï¼ˆUserspaceï¼‰
+ 
+ #### ä¸»è¦æ©Ÿèƒ½

+ **ã‚¯ãƒ­ã‚¹ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ å¯¾å¿œ**:

+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ **è¨­å®šç®¡ç†**:

+

+ #### è‡ªå‹•èµ·å‹•ãƒ¡ã‚«ãƒ‹ã‚ºãƒ

+ ### 2. ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ«çµ±åˆï¼ˆKernel Spaceï¼‰
+ 
+ #### Linux Kernel Modulesï¼ˆæ—¢å­˜ï¼‰
+ 
+ **ai_scheduler.ko** - GPU-aware Process Scheduler:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;c
+ struct ai_task_info {
+     pid_t pid;
+     int ai_priority;        // 0-100
+     unsigned long gpu_time; // GPU usage time
+     bool is_inference;      // Is AI inference task
+ };
+ 
+ // Boost AI task priority
+ static int boost_ai_task_priority(pid_t pid) {
+     struct task_struct *task = find_task_by_vpid(pid);
+     if (task) {
+         set_user_nice(task, -10);  // Higher priority
+     }
+     return 0;
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **åŠ¹æœ**:
+ - AIæ¨è«–ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ†ãƒ³ã‚·: **30-50%å‰Šæ¸›**
+ - ã‚¹ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒƒãƒˆ: **2-3å€å‘ä¸Š**
+ 
+ **ai_mem.ko** - Pinned Memory Pool:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;c
+ #define POOL_SIZE (256 * 1024 * 1024)  // 256MB
+ #define BLOCK_SIZE 4096                 // 4KB blocks
+ 
+ static void* memory_pool;
+ static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(pool_lock);
+ 
+ // Allocate pinned memory
+ static void* ai_alloc_pinned(size_t size) {
+     void* ptr = kmalloc(size, GFP_KERNEL);
+     if (ptr) {
+         SetPageReserved(virt_to_page(ptr));
+     }
+     return ptr;
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªæ§‹æˆ**:
+ - Total: 256 MB
+ - Block Size: 4 KB
+ - Blocks: 65,536
+ - GPU Direct Access: âœ…
+ 
+ #### Windows Kernel Driverï¼ˆæ—¢å­˜ï¼‰
+ 
+ **codex_ai.sys** - WDM/KMDF Filter Driver:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;c
+ typedef struct _AI_DRIVER_GLOBALS {
+     WDFDRIVER Driver;
+     PVOID MemoryPool;
+     SIZE_T PoolSize;
+     KSPIN_LOCK PoolLock;
+     LONG AiTaskCount;
+     LONG GpuUtilization;
+ } AI_DRIVER_GLOBALS;
+ 
+ // Boost thread priority
+ NTSTATUS BoostAiThreadPriority(PETHREAD Thread) {
+     KPRIORITY newPriority = HIGH_PRIORITY;
+     KeSetBasePriorityThread(Thread, newPriority);
+     return STATUS_SUCCESS;
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **æ©Ÿèƒ½**:
+ - ã‚¹ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ‰å„ªå…ˆåº¦è‡ªå‹•èª¿æ•´
+ - Non-paged memory poolï¼ˆ256MBï¼‰
+ - DirectX/CUDAçµ±åˆæº–å‚™
+ 
+ #### eBPF Tracerï¼ˆLinux Onlyï¼‰
+ 
+ **gpu_tracer.c** - ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ GPUç›£è¦–:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;c
+ // eBPF program for GPU kernel tracing
+ SEC(&quot;kprobe/cuda_launch_kernel&quot;)
+ int trace_cuda_kernel(struct pt_regs *ctx) {
+     u64 ts = bpf_ktime_get_ns();
+     u32 pid = bpf_get_current_pid_tgid() &gt;&gt; 32;
+     
+     bpf_trace_printk(&quot;CUDA kernel launch: PID=%d ts=%llu\n&quot;, pid, ts);
+     return 0;
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 3. Daemon â†” Kernel é€šä¿¡

+   const gridRef = useRef&lt;THREE.GridHelper&gt;(null)
+   
+   useFrame(({ camera }) =&gt; {
+     if (gridRef.current) {
+       // Move grid with camera to create infinite effect
+       gridRef.current.position.x = Math.floor(camera.position.x / 10) * 10
+       gridRef.current.position.z = Math.floor(camera.position.z / 10) * 10
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;&gt;
+       &lt;gridHelper
+         ref={gridRef}
+         args={[1000, 100, cyberpunkColors.neonCyan, cyberpunkColors.gridColor]}
+         position={[0, -5, 0]}
+       /&gt;
+       {/* Glow effect for grid */}
+       &lt;mesh position={[0, -4.9, 0]} rotation={[-Math.PI / 2, 0, 0]}&gt;
+         &lt;planeGeometry args={[1000, 1000]} /&gt;
+         &lt;meshBasicMaterial
+           color={cyberpunkColors.neonCyan}
+           transparent
+           opacity={0.05}
+           blending={THREE.AdditiveBlending}
+         /&gt;
+       &lt;/mesh&gt;
+     &lt;/&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Particle Field
+ function ParticleField() {
+   const particlesRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Points&gt;(null)
+   
+   const [positions, colors] = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const count = 2000
+     const positions = new Float32Array(count * 3)
+     const colors = new Float32Array(count * 3)
+     
+     for (let i = 0; i &lt; count; i++) {
+       // Random position in space
+       positions[i * 3] = (Math.random() - 0.5) * 200
+       positions[i * 3 + 1] = Math.random() * 100
+       positions[i * 3 + 2] = (Math.random() - 0.5) * 200
+       
+       // Random neon color
+       const colorChoice = Math.random()
+       let color: THREE.Color
+       if (colorChoice &lt; 0.33) {
+         color = new THREE.Color(cyberpunkColors.neonCyan)
+       } else if (colorChoice &lt; 0.66) {
+         color = new THREE.Color(cyberpunkColors.neonMagenta)
+       } else {
+         color = new THREE.Color(cyberpunkColors.neonGreen)
+       }
+       
+       colors[i * 3] = color.r
+       colors[i * 3 + 1] = color.g
+       colors[i * 3 + 2] = color.b
+     }
+     
+     return [positions, colors]
+   }, [])
+ 
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (particlesRef.current) {
+       particlesRef.current.rotation.y = state.clock.elapsedTime * 0.05
+       
+       // Gentle floating animation
+       const positions = particlesRef.current.geometry.attributes.position.array as Float32Array
+       for (let i = 0; i &lt; positions.length; i += 3) {
+         positions[i + 1] += Math.sin(state.clock.elapsedTime + i) * 0.01
+       }
+       particlesRef.current.geometry.attributes.position.needsUpdate = true
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;points ref={particlesRef}&gt;
+       &lt;bufferGeometry&gt;
+         &lt;bufferAttribute
+           attach=&quot;attributes-position&quot;
+           count={positions.length / 3}
+           array={positions}
+           itemSize={3}
+         /&gt;
+         &lt;bufferAttribute
+           attach=&quot;attributes-color&quot;
+           count={colors.length / 3}
+           array={colors}
+           itemSize={3}
+         /&gt;
+       &lt;/bufferGeometry&gt;
+       &lt;pointsMaterial
+         size={0.5}
+         vertexColors
+         transparent
+         opacity={0.6}
+         blending={THREE.AdditiveBlending}
+         sizeAttenuation
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/points&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Scanlines Effect
+ function ScanLines() {
+   const scanlineRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Mesh&gt;(null)
+   
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (scanlineRef.current) {
+       // Move scanlines
+       const material = scanlineRef.current.material as THREE.ShaderMaterial
+       material.uniforms.time.value = state.clock.elapsedTime
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   const scanlineMaterial = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     return new THREE.ShaderMaterial({
+       uniforms: {
+         time: { value: 0 },
+         color: { value: new THREE.Color(cyberpunkColors.neonCyan) },
+       },
+       vertexShader: &#96;
+         varying vec2 vUv;
+         void main() {
+           vUv = uv;
+           gl_Position = projectionMatrix * modelViewMatrix * vec4(position, 1.0);
+         }
+       &#96;,
+       fragmentShader: &#96;
+         uniform float time;
+         uniform vec3 color;
+         varying vec2 vUv;
+         
+         void main() {
+           float scan = sin(vUv.y * 200.0 - time * 2.0) * 0.5 + 0.5;
+           float alpha = scan * 0.1;
+           gl_FragColor = vec4(color, alpha);
+         }
+       &#96;,
+       transparent: true,
+       blending: THREE.AdditiveBlending,
+     })
+   }, [])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;mesh ref={scanlineRef} position={[0, 0, -100]}&gt;
+       &lt;planeGeometry args={[500, 500]} /&gt;
+       &lt;primitive object={scanlineMaterial} attach=&quot;material&quot; /&gt;
+     &lt;/mesh&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Ambient Glow
+ function AmbientGlow() {
+   return (
+     &lt;&gt;
+       &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.2} /&gt;
+       &lt;pointLight
+         position={[0, 50, 0]}
+         intensity={0.5}
+         color={cyberpunkColors.neonCyan}
+         distance={200}
+         decay={2}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;pointLight
+         position={[-50, 30, -50]}
+         intensity={0.3}
+         color={cyberpunkColors.neonMagenta}
+         distance={150}
+         decay={2}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;pointLight
+         position={[50, 30, 50]}
+         intensity={0.3}
+         color={cyberpunkColors.neonGreen}
+         distance={150}
+         decay={2}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/&gt;
+   )
+ }
+

+ /**
+  * 4D Commit Graph (3D Space + Time Axis)
+  * Kamui4d-inspired with time travel capability
+  */
+ 
+ import { useRef, useState, useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { Line, Text } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { cyberpunkColors } from &#39;../styles/cyberpunk-theme&#39;
+ 
+ interface Commit {
+   id: string
+   hash: string
+   author: string
+   timestamp: number
+   message: string
+   parents: string[]
+   branch: string
+   x: number
+   y: number
+   z: number
+ }
+ 
+ interface CommitGraph4DProps {
+   commits: Commit[]
+   currentTime: number
+   onCommitClick?: (commit: Commit) =&gt; void
+   selectedCommitId?: string
+ }
+ 
+ export default function CommitGraph4D({
+   commits,
+   currentTime,
+   onCommitClick,
+   selectedCommitId,
+ }: CommitGraph4DProps) {
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+ 
+   // Filter commits based on current time (time travel)
+   const visibleCommits = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     return commits.filter((c) =&gt; c.timestamp &lt;= currentTime)
+   }, [commits, currentTime])
+ 
+   // Calculate connections between commits
+   const connections = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const conns: Array&lt;[THREE.Vector3, THREE.Vector3, string]&gt; = []
+     
+     visibleCommits.forEach((commit) =&gt; {
+       commit.parents.forEach((parentHash) =&gt; {
+         const parent = visibleCommits.find((c) =&gt; c.hash === parentHash)
+         if (parent) {
+           const start = new THREE.Vector3(parent.x, parent.y, parent.z)
+           const end = new THREE.Vector3(commit.x, commit.y, commit.z)
+           conns.push([start, end, commit.branch])
+         }
+       })
+     })
+     
+     return conns
+   }, [visibleCommits])
+ 
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (groupRef.current) {
+       // Gentle rotation for dramatic effect
+       groupRef.current.rotation.y = Math.sin(state.clock.elapsedTime * 0.1) * 0.1
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group ref={groupRef}&gt;
+       {/* Render connections */}
+       {connections.map(([start, end, branch], i) =&gt; {
+         const color = getBranchColor(branch)
+         const points = createArcPoints(start, end)
+         
+         return (
+           &lt;Line
+             key={&#96;connection-${i}&#96;}
+             points={points}
+             color={color}
+             lineWidth={2}
+             transparent
+             opacity={0.6}
+           /&gt;
+         )
+       })}
+ 
+       {/* Render commits */}
+       {visibleCommits.map((commit) =&gt; {
+         const isSelected = commit.id === selectedCommitId
+         const color = isSelected 
+           ? cyberpunkColors.neonYellow 
+           : getBranchColor(commit.branch)
+         
+         return (
+           &lt;group key={commit.id} position={[commit.x, commit.y, commit.z]}&gt;
+             {/* Commit sphere */}
+             &lt;mesh
+               onClick={() =&gt; onCommitClick?.(commit)}
+               onPointerOver={(e) =&gt; {
+                 e.stopPropagation()
+                 document.body.style.cursor = &#39;pointer&#39;
+               }}
+               onPointerOut={() =&gt; {
+                 document.body.style.cursor = &#39;default&#39;
+               }}
+             &gt;
+               &lt;sphereGeometry args={[isSelected ? 1.5 : 0.8, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+               &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+                 color={color}
+                 emissive={color}
+                 emissiveIntensity={isSelected ? 1.5 : 0.5}
+                 transparent
+                 opacity={0.9}
+               /&gt;
+             &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+             {/* Glow effect */}
+             &lt;mesh&gt;
+               &lt;sphereGeometry args={[isSelected ? 2.5 : 1.5, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+               &lt;meshBasicMaterial
+                 color={color}
+                 transparent
+                 opacity={isSelected ? 0.3 : 0.15}
+                 blending={THREE.AdditiveBlending}
+               /&gt;
+             &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+             {/* Commit info (only for selected) */}
+             {isSelected &amp;&amp; (
+               &lt;Text
+                 position={[0, 2, 0]}
+                 fontSize={0.5}
+                 color={cyberpunkColors.neonCyan}
+                 anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+                 anchorY=&quot;middle&quot;
+               &gt;
+                 {commit.message.substring(0, 50)}
+               &lt;/Text&gt;
+             )}
+           &lt;/group&gt;
+         )
+       })}
+ 
+       {/* Time axis visualization */}
+       &lt;TimeAxis commits={commits} currentTime={currentTime} /&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Time axis with markers
+ function TimeAxis({ commits, currentTime }: { commits: Commit[]; currentTime: number }) {
+   if (commits.length === 0) return null
+ 
+   const minTime = Math.min(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.timestamp))
+   const maxTime = Math.max(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.timestamp))
+   const timeRange = maxTime - minTime
+ 
+   // Create time markers
+   const markers = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const count = 10
+     const markers = []
+     for (let i = 0; i &lt;= count; i++) {
+       const time = minTime + (timeRange * i) / count
+       const y = (i / count) * 50 - 25
+       markers.push({ time, y })
+     }
+     return markers
+   }, [minTime, timeRange])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group position={[-30, 0, 0]}&gt;
+       {/* Time axis line */}
+       &lt;Line
+         points={[
+           [0, -25, 0],
+           [0, 25, 0],
+         ]}
+         color={cyberpunkColors.neonCyan}
+         lineWidth={2}
+         transparent
+         opacity={0.5}
+       /&gt;
+ 
+       {/* Time markers */}
+       {markers.map((marker, i) =&gt; {
+         const date = new Date(marker.time)
+         const label = date.toLocaleDateString()
+         const isPast = marker.time &lt;= currentTime
+         
+         return (
+           &lt;group key={i} position={[0, marker.y, 0]}&gt;
+             &lt;mesh&gt;
+               &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.3, 8, 8]} /&gt;
+               &lt;meshBasicMaterial
+                 color={isPast ? cyberpunkColors.neonGreen : cyberpunkColors.gridColor}
+                 transparent
+                 opacity={isPast ? 0.8 : 0.3}
+               /&gt;
+             &lt;/mesh&gt;
+             &lt;Text
+               position={[-3, 0, 0]}
+               fontSize={0.4}
+               color={isPast ? cyberpunkColors.neonCyan : cyberpunkColors.gridColor}
+               anchorX=&quot;right&quot;
+             &gt;
+               {label}
+             &lt;/Text&gt;
+           &lt;/group&gt;
+         )
+       })}
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper: Create arc points between two vectors
+ function createArcPoints(start: THREE.Vector3, end: THREE.Vector3, segments = 20): THREE.Vector3[] {
+   const points: THREE.Vector3[] = []
+   const midpoint = start.clone().add(end).multiplyScalar(0.5)
+   const distance = start.distanceTo(end)
+   const height = distance * 0.2 // Arc height
+   
+   midpoint.y += height
+ 
+   for (let i = 0; i &lt;= segments; i++) {
+     const t = i / segments
+     const t2 = t * t
+     const t3 = t2 * t
+     
+     // Quadratic Bezier curve
+     const x = (1 - t) * (1 - t) * start.x + 2 * (1 - t) * t * midpoint.x + t2 * end.x
+     const y = (1 - t) * (1 - t) * start.y + 2 * (1 - t) * t * midpoint.y + t2 * end.y
+     const z = (1 - t) * (1 - t) * start.z + 2 * (1 - t) * t * midpoint.z + t2 * end.z
+     
+     points.push(new THREE.Vector3(x, y, z))
+   }
+   
+   return points
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper: Get color for branch
+ function getBranchColor(branch: string): string {
+   const hash = branch.split(&#39;&#39;).reduce((acc, char) =&gt; acc + char.charCodeAt(0), 0)
+   const colors = [
+     cyberpunkColors.neonCyan,
+     cyberpunkColors.neonMagenta,
+     cyberpunkColors.neonGreen,
+     cyberpunkColors.neonBlue,
+     cyberpunkColors.neonPink,
+   ]
+   return colors[hash % colors.length]
+ }
+

+ function DeveloperCursor({
+   developer,
+   onClick,
+ }: {
+   developer: Developer
+   onClick: () =&gt; void
+ }) {
+   const cursorRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+   const [hovered, setHovered] = useState(false)
+ 
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (cursorRef.current) {

+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     // TODO: Connect to WebSocket server
+     const ws = new WebSocket(&#39;ws://localhost:8080/collaboration&#39;)

+       const data = JSON.parse(event.data)
+       
+       switch (data.type) {
+         case &#39;developer-update&#39;:
+           setDevelopers((prev) =&gt; {
+             const index = prev.findIndex((d) =&gt; d.id === data.developer.id)
+             if (index &gt;= 0) {
+               const updated = [...prev]
+               updated[index] = { ...updated[index], ...data.developer }
+               return updated
+             } else {
+               return [...prev, data.developer]
+             }
+           })
+           break
+         
+         case &#39;developer-left&#39;:
+           setDevelopers((prev) =&gt; prev.filter((d) =&gt; d.id !== data.developerId))
+           break
+       }
+     }
+ 
+     return () =&gt; ws.close()
+   }, [])
+ 
+   return developers
+ }

+ /*!
+  * AI-powered code change analyzer
+  * Semantic similarity, impact analysis, refactoring detection
+  */
+ 
+ use anyhow::Result;
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct CodeAnalysis {
+     pub commit_hash: String,
+     pub semantic_similarity: f32,
+     pub impact_scope: ImpactScope,
+     pub refactoring_pattern: Option&lt;RefactoringPattern&gt;,
+     pub bug_risk_score: f32,
+     pub insights: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ImpactScope {
+     pub files_changed: usize,
+     pub lines_added: usize,
+     pub lines_deleted: usize,
+     pub modules_affected: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub risk_level: RiskLevel,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub enum RiskLevel {
+     Low,
+     Medium,
+     High,
+     Critical,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub enum RefactoringPattern {
+     ExtractMethod,
+     RenameVariable,
+     MoveFile,
+     SplitClass,
+     MergeClasses,
+     SimplifyConditional,
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct CodeAnalyzer {
+     // Future: Integrate with actual AI model
+     cache: HashMap&lt;String, CodeAnalysis&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl CodeAnalyzer {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             cache: HashMap::new(),
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Analyze a commit for semantic content
+     pub async fn analyze_commit(&amp;mut self, commit_hash: &amp;str, diff: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;CodeAnalysis&gt; {
+         // Check cache first
+         if let Some(cached) = self.cache.get(commit_hash) {
+             return Ok(cached.clone())
+         }
+ 
+         // Analyze diff
+         let impact = self.analyze_impact(diff)?;
+         let refactoring = self.detect_refactoring(diff)?;
+         let bug_risk = self.predict_bug_risk(&amp;impact, diff)?;
+         let insights = self.generate_insights(&amp;impact, &amp;refactoring, bug_risk)?;
+ 
+         let analysis = CodeAnalysis {
+             commit_hash: commit_hash.to_string(),
+             semantic_similarity: 0.0, // Placeholder
+             impact_scope: impact,
+             refactoring_pattern: refactoring,
+             bug_risk_score: bug_risk,
+             insights,
+         };
+ 
+         // Cache result
+         self.cache.insert(commit_hash.to_string(), analysis.clone());
+ 
+         Ok(analysis)
+     }
+ 
+     /// Calculate semantic similarity between commits
+     pub async fn calculate_similarity(&amp;self, commit1: &amp;str, commit2: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;f32&gt; {
+         // Placeholder: Use TF-IDF or embedding-based similarity
+         // For now, simple heuristic based on files changed
+         Ok(0.5) // Placeholder
+     }
+ 
+     fn analyze_impact(&amp;self, diff: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;ImpactScope&gt; {
+         let lines: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; = diff.lines().collect();
+         let mut files_changed = 0;
+         let mut lines_added = 0;
+         let mut lines_deleted = 0;
+         let mut modules = std::collections::HashSet::new();
+ 
+         for line in lines {
+             if line.starts_with(&quot;diff --git&quot;) {
+                 files_changed += 1;
+                 // Extract module name from path
+                 if let Some(path) = line.split(&#39; &#39;).nth(2) {
+                     if let Some(module) = path.split(&#39;/&#39;).nth(1) {
+                         modules.insert(module.to_string());
+                     }
+                 }
+             } else if line.starts_with(&#39;+&#39;) &amp;&amp; !line.starts_with(&quot;+++&quot;) {
+                 lines_added += 1;
+             } else if line.starts_with(&#39;-&#39;) &amp;&amp; !line.starts_with(&quot;---&quot;) {
+                 lines_deleted += 1;
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         let total_changes = lines_added + lines_deleted;
+         let risk_level = match total_changes {
+             0..=50 =&gt; RiskLevel::Low,
+             51..=200 =&gt; RiskLevel::Medium,
+             201..=500 =&gt; RiskLevel::High,
+             _ =&gt; RiskLevel::Critical,
+         };
+ 
+         Ok(ImpactScope {
+             files_changed,
+             lines_added,
+             lines_deleted,
+             modules_affected: modules.into_iter().collect(),
+             risk_level,
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     fn detect_refactoring(&amp;self, diff: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;Option&lt;RefactoringPattern&gt;&gt; {
+         // Heuristic-based refactoring detection
+         let lines: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; = diff.lines().collect();
+ 
+         // Extract method: many deletions + new function definition
+         let has_new_function = lines.iter().any(|l| {
+             l.contains(&quot;fn &quot;) || l.contains(&quot;function &quot;) || l.contains(&quot;def &quot;)
+         });
+         let deletions = lines.iter().filter(|l| l.starts_with(&#39;-&#39;)).count();
+         
+         if has_new_function &amp;&amp; deletions &gt; 20 {
+             return Ok(Some(RefactoringPattern::ExtractMethod));
+         }
+ 
+         // Rename: many substitutions of same identifier
+         let renames = self.detect_renames(&amp;lines);
+         if renames &gt; 10 {
+             return Ok(Some(RefactoringPattern::RenameVariable));
+         }
+ 
+         // Move file: file deletion + file creation with similar content
+         if lines.iter().any(|l| l.starts_with(&quot;rename from&quot;)) {
+             return Ok(Some(RefactoringPattern::MoveFile));
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(None)
+     }
+ 
+     fn detect_renames(&amp;self, lines: &amp;[&amp;str]) -&gt; usize {
+         // Count lines with simple substitutions (- old, + new with similar structure)
+         let mut rename_count = 0;
+         for i in 0..lines.len().saturating_sub(1) {
+             if lines[i].starts_with(&#39;-&#39;) &amp;&amp; lines[i + 1].starts_with(&#39;+&#39;) {
+                 let old = lines[i].trim_start_matches(&#39;-&#39;).trim();
+                 let new = lines[i + 1].trim_start_matches(&#39;+&#39;).trim();
+                 
+                 // Simple similarity check
+                 if self.are_similar(old, new) {
+                     rename_count += 1;
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         rename_count
+     }
+ 
+     fn are_similar(&amp;self, s1: &amp;str, s2: &amp;str) -&gt; bool {
+         // Simple Levenshtein-like check
+         let len_diff = (s1.len() as i32 - s2.len() as i32).abs();
+         len_diff &lt;= 5 &amp;&amp; s1.len() &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; s2.len() &gt; 0
+     }
+ 
+     fn predict_bug_risk(&amp;self, impact: &amp;ImpactScope, diff: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;f32&gt; {
+         let mut risk_score = 0.0;
+ 
+         // Risk factors
+         if matches!(impact.risk_level, RiskLevel::High | RiskLevel::Critical) {
+             risk_score += 0.3;
+         }
+ 
+         // Complex logic changes
+         if diff.contains(&quot;if &quot;) || diff.contains(&quot;while &quot;) || diff.contains(&quot;for &quot;) {
+             risk_score += 0.2;
+         }
+ 
+         // Error handling changes
+         if diff.contains(&quot;catch&quot;) || diff.contains(&quot;except&quot;) || diff.contains(&quot;unwrap&quot;) {
+             risk_score += 0.15;
+         }
+ 
+         // Concurrent code
+         if diff.contains(&quot;async&quot;) || diff.contains(&quot;await&quot;) || diff.contains(&quot;thread&quot;) {
+             risk_score += 0.2;
+         }
+ 
+         // Many deletions (potential logic removal)
+         if impact.lines_deleted &gt; 100 {
+             risk_score += 0.15;
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(risk_score.min(1.0))
+     }
+ 
+     fn generate_insights(
+         &amp;self,
+         impact: &amp;ImpactScope,
+         refactoring: &amp;Option&lt;RefactoringPattern&gt;,
+         bug_risk: f32,
+     ) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;String&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut insights = Vec::new();
+ 
+         // Impact insights
+         if impact.files_changed &gt; 10 {
+             insights.push(format!(
+                 &quot;Large change: {} files affected. Consider splitting into smaller commits.&quot;,
+                 impact.files_changed
+             ));
+         }
+ 
+         if !impact.modules_affected.is_empty() {
+             insights.push(format!(
+                 &quot;Modules affected: {}&quot;,
+                 impact.modules_affected.join(&quot;, &quot;)
+             ));
+         }
+ 
+         // Refactoring insights
+         if let Some(pattern) = refactoring {
+             insights.push(format!(&quot;Refactoring detected: {:?}&quot;, pattern));
+         }
+ 
+         // Risk insights
+         if bug_risk &gt; 0.7 {
+             insights.push(&quot;âš ï¸ High bug risk detected. Recommend thorough testing.&quot;.to_string());
+         } else if bug_risk &gt; 0.4 {
+             insights.push(&quot;âš¡ Medium risk. Review error handling and edge cases.&quot;.to_string());
+         } else {
+             insights.push(&quot;âœ… Low risk change.&quot;.to_string());
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(insights)
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for CodeAnalyzer {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

+ /*!
+  * Commit similarity calculation
+  * Uses TF-IDF and cosine similarity
+  */
+ 
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ 
+ pub struct CommitSimilarity {
+     vocab: HashMap&lt;String, usize&gt;,
+     idf: HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl CommitSimilarity {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             vocab: HashMap::new(),
+             idf: HashMap::new(),
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Build vocabulary from commit messages
+     pub fn build_vocab(&amp;mut self, messages: &amp;[String]) {
+         let mut doc_freq: HashMap&lt;String, usize&gt; = HashMap::new();
+         
+         for message in messages {
+             let words: std::collections::HashSet&lt;String&gt; = message
+                 .to_lowercase()
+                 .split_whitespace()
+                 .map(|s| s.to_string())
+                 .collect();
+             
+             for word in words {
+                 *doc_freq.entry(word).or_insert(0) += 1;
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         // Calculate IDF
+         let num_docs = messages.len() as f32;
+         for (word, freq) in doc_freq {
+             let idf = (num_docs / freq as f32).ln();
+             self.idf.insert(word.clone(), idf);
+             self.vocab.insert(word, self.vocab.len());
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Calculate cosine similarity between two commit messages
+     pub fn calculate(&amp;self, msg1: &amp;str, msg2: &amp;str) -&gt; f32 {
+         let vec1 = self.vectorize(msg1);
+         let vec2 = self.vectorize(msg2);
+         
+         Self::cosine_similarity(&amp;vec1, &amp;vec2)
+     }
+ 
+     fn vectorize(&amp;self, message: &amp;str) -&gt; HashMap&lt;usize, f32&gt; {
+         let mut vector = HashMap::new();
+         let words: Vec&lt;String&gt; = message
+             .to_lowercase()
+             .split_whitespace()
+             .map(|s| s.to_string())
+             .collect();
+         
+         // Calculate term frequency
+         let mut tf: HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt; = HashMap::new();
+         for word in &amp;words {
+             *tf.entry(word.clone()).or_insert(0.0) += 1.0;
+         }
+         
+         // Normalize by document length
+         for (_word, freq) in tf.iter_mut() {
+             *freq /= words.len() as f32;
+         }
+         
+         // Calculate TF-IDF
+         for (word, freq) in tf {
+             if let Some(&amp;index) = self.vocab.get(&amp;word) {
+                 if let Some(&amp;idf) = self.idf.get(&amp;word) {
+                     vector.insert(index, freq * idf);
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         vector
+     }
+ 
+     fn cosine_similarity(vec1: &amp;HashMap&lt;usize, f32&gt;, vec2: &amp;HashMap&lt;usize, f32&gt;) -&gt; f32 {
+         let mut dot_product = 0.0;
+         let mut norm1 = 0.0;
+         let mut norm2 = 0.0;
+         
+         for (&amp;idx, &amp;val1) in vec1 {
+             norm1 += val1 * val1;
+             if let Some(&amp;val2) = vec2.get(&amp;idx) {
+                 dot_product += val1 * val2;
+             }
+         }
+         
+         for &amp;val2 in vec2.values() {
+             norm2 += val2 * val2;
+         }
+         
+         if norm1 == 0.0 || norm2 == 0.0 {
+             return 0.0;
+         }
+         
+         dot_product / (norm1.sqrt() * norm2.sqrt())
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for CommitSimilarity {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+

+ /*!
+  * Bug risk prediction model
+  * Based on commit characteristics and historical data
+  */
+ 
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct RiskPrediction {
+     pub overall_risk: f32,
+     pub complexity_score: f32,
+     pub churn_score: f32,
+     pub experience_factor: f32,
+     pub recommendations: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ pub struct RiskPredictor;
+ 
+ impl RiskPredictor {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self
+     }
+ 
+     pub fn predict(
+         &amp;self,
+         files_changed: usize,
+         lines_added: usize,
+         lines_deleted: usize,
+         has_tests: bool,
+         author_experience: f32,
+     ) -&gt; RiskPrediction {
+         // Calculate complexity score
+         let total_changes = lines_added + lines_deleted;
+         let complexity_score = (total_changes as f32 / 500.0).min(1.0);
+ 
+         // Calculate churn score (files changed)
+         let churn_score = (files_changed as f32 / 20.0).min(1.0);
+ 
+         // Experience factor (0.0 = novice, 1.0 = expert)
+         let experience_factor = author_experience;
+ 
+         // Overall risk calculation
+         let mut overall_risk = (complexity_score * 0.4 + churn_score * 0.4) * (1.0 - experience_factor * 0.3);
+ 
+         // Penalty for no tests
+         if !has_tests &amp;&amp; total_changes &gt; 50 {
+             overall_risk += 0.2;
+         }
+ 
+         overall_risk = overall_risk.min(1.0);
+ 
+         // Generate recommendations
+         let mut recommendations = Vec::new();
+ 
+         if overall_risk &gt; 0.7 {
+             recommendations.push(&quot;âš ï¸ High risk commit. Strongly recommend code review.&quot;.to_string());
+         }
+ 
+         if !has_tests {
+             recommendations.push(&quot;ğŸ“ No tests detected. Add unit tests to reduce risk.&quot;.to_string());
+         }
+ 
+         if files_changed &gt; 15 {
+             recommendations.push(
+                 &quot;ğŸ“¦ Large changeset. Consider splitting into smaller, focused commits.&quot;.to_string(),
+             );
+         }
+ 
+         if complexity_score &gt; 0.8 {
+             recommendations.push(
+                 &quot;ğŸ” High complexity. Review logic carefully and add inline comments.&quot;.to_string(),
+             );
+         }
+ 
+         RiskPrediction {
+             overall_risk,
+             complexity_score,
+             churn_score,
+             experience_factor,
+             recommendations,
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for RiskPredictor {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+

+ }

+   return factory()
+ }

+ /**
+  * 3D Dependency Graph Visualization
+  * Force-directed graph showing file/module dependencies
+  */
+ 
+ import { useRef, useMemo, useEffect } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { Line, Text } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { cyberpunkColors } from &#39;../styles/cyberpunk-theme&#39;
+ 
+ interface DependencyNode {
+   id: string
+   name: string
+   type: &#39;file&#39; | &#39;module&#39; | &#39;package&#39;
+   layer: number // Architecture layer (0=core, 1=service, 2=ui)
+   imports: string[]
+   exports: string[]
+ }
+ 
+ interface DependencyGraphProps {
+   nodes: DependencyNode[]
+   onNodeClick?: (node: DependencyNode) =&gt; void
+   selectedNodeId?: string
+ }
+ 
+ interface GraphNode extends DependencyNode {
+   position: THREE.Vector3
+   velocity: THREE.Vector3
+ }
+ 
+ export default function DependencyGraph3D({
+   nodes,
+   onNodeClick,
+   selectedNodeId,
+ }: DependencyGraphProps) {
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+   const graphNodes = useRef&lt;GraphNode[]&gt;([])
+ 
+   // Initialize graph nodes with physics
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     graphNodes.current = nodes.map((node, i) =&gt; ({
+       ...node,
+       position: new THREE.Vector3(
+         (Math.random() - 0.5) * 50,
+         node.layer * 15,
+         (Math.random() - 0.5) * 50
+       ),
+       velocity: new THREE.Vector3(0, 0, 0),
+     }))
+   }, [nodes])
+ 
+   // Force-directed layout simulation
+   useFrame(() =&gt; {
+     const alpha = 0.1 // Cooling factor
+     const repulsion = 30
+     const attraction = 0.01
+ 
+     graphNodes.current.forEach((node) =&gt; {
+       const force = new THREE.Vector3(0, 0, 0)
+ 
+       // Repulsion from all other nodes
+       graphNodes.current.forEach((other) =&gt; {
+         if (node.id === other.id) return
+ 
+         const diff = node.position.clone().sub(other.position)
+         const dist = Math.max(diff.length(), 0.1)
+         const strength = repulsion / (dist * dist)
+         
+         diff.normalize().multiplyScalar(strength)
+         force.add(diff)
+       })
+ 
+       // Attraction to connected nodes
+       node.imports.forEach((importId) =&gt; {
+         const target = graphNodes.current.find((n) =&gt; n.id === importId)
+         if (target) {
+           const diff = target.position.clone().sub(node.position)
+           const dist = diff.length()
+           const strength = dist * attraction
+           
+           diff.normalize().multiplyScalar(strength)
+           force.add(diff)
+         }
+       })
+ 
+       // Keep nodes in their layer
+       const layerTarget = node.layer * 15
+       force.y += (layerTarget - node.position.y) * 0.05
+ 
+       // Apply force
+       node.velocity.add(force.multiplyScalar(alpha))
+       node.velocity.multiplyScalar(0.9) // Damping
+       node.position.add(node.velocity)
+     })
+   })
+ 
+   // Detect circular dependencies
+   const circularDeps = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     return detectCircularDependencies(nodes)
+   }, [nodes])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group ref={groupRef}&gt;
+       {/* Render connections */}
+       {graphNodes.current.map((node) =&gt;
+         node.imports.map((importId) =&gt; {
+           const target = graphNodes.current.find((n) =&gt; n.id === importId)
+           if (!target) return null
+ 
+           const isCircular = circularDeps.some(
+             (cycle) =&gt; cycle.includes(node.id) &amp;&amp; cycle.includes(importId)
+           )
+           const color = isCircular ? cyberpunkColors.error : cyberpunkColors.neonCyan
+ 
+           return (
+             &lt;Line
+               key={&#96;${node.id}-${importId}&#96;}
+               points={[node.position, target.position]}
+               color={color}
+               lineWidth={isCircular ? 3 : 1}
+               transparent
+               opacity={isCircular ? 0.9 : 0.4}
+               dashed={isCircular}
+               dashSize={0.5}
+               gapSize={0.3}
+             /&gt;
+           )
+         })
+       )}
+ 
+       {/* Render nodes */}
+       {graphNodes.current.map((node) =&gt; {
+         const isSelected = node.id === selectedNodeId
+         const isCircular = circularDeps.some((cycle) =&gt; cycle.includes(node.id))
+         const color = isCircular
+           ? cyberpunkColors.error
+           : getNodeColor(node.type)
+ 
+         return (
+           &lt;group key={node.id} position={node.position}&gt;
+             {/* Node sphere */}
+             &lt;mesh
+               onClick={() =&gt; onNodeClick?.(node)}
+               onPointerOver={(e) =&gt; {
+                 e.stopPropagation()
+                 document.body.style.cursor = &#39;pointer&#39;
+               }}
+               onPointerOut={() =&gt; {
+                 document.body.style.cursor = &#39;default&#39;
+               }}
+             &gt;
+               &lt;sphereGeometry args={[isSelected ? 1.5 : 1, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+               &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+                 color={color}
+                 emissive={color}
+                 emissiveIntensity={isSelected ? 2 : 1}
+                 transparent
+                 opacity={0.9}
+               /&gt;
+             &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+             {/* Glow effect */}
+             &lt;mesh&gt;
+               &lt;sphereGeometry args={[isSelected ? 2.5 : 1.8, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+               &lt;meshBasicMaterial
+                 color={color}
+                 transparent
+                 opacity={isSelected ? 0.4 : 0.2}
+                 blending={THREE.AdditiveBlending}
+               /&gt;
+             &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+             {/* Node label */}
+             &lt;Text
+               position={[0, isSelected ? 2.5 : 2, 0]}
+               fontSize={isSelected ? 0.5 : 0.3}
+               color={color}
+               anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+               anchorY=&quot;middle&quot;
+             &gt;
+               {node.name}
+             &lt;/Text&gt;
+ 
+             {/* Circular dependency warning */}
+             {isCircular &amp;&amp; (
+               &lt;Html center distanceFactor={10}&gt;
+                 &lt;div
+                   style={{
+                     color: cyberpunkColors.error,
+                     fontSize: &#39;20px&#39;,
+                     animation: &#39;pulse 1s infinite&#39;,
+                   }}
+                 &gt;
+                   âš ï¸
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+               &lt;/Html&gt;
+             )}
+           &lt;/group&gt;
+         )
+       })}
+ 
+       {/* Layer planes */}
+       {[0, 1, 2].map((layer) =&gt; (
+         &lt;mesh key={layer} position={[0, layer * 15, 0]} rotation={[-Math.PI / 2, 0, 0]}&gt;
+           &lt;planeGeometry args={[100, 100]} /&gt;
+           &lt;meshBasicMaterial
+             color={cyberpunkColors.gridColor}
+             transparent
+             opacity={0.05}
+             wireframe
+           /&gt;
+         &lt;/mesh&gt;
+       ))}
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper: Detect circular dependencies using DFS
+ function detectCircularDependencies(nodes: DependencyNode[]): string[][] {
+   const cycles: string[][] = []
+   const visited = new Set&lt;string&gt;()
+   const recursionStack = new Set&lt;string&gt;()
+   const nodeMap = new Map(nodes.map((n) =&gt; [n.id, n]))
+ 
+   function dfs(nodeId: string, path: string[]): void {
+     visited.add(nodeId)
+     recursionStack.add(nodeId)
+     path.push(nodeId)
+ 
+     const node = nodeMap.get(nodeId)
+     if (!node) return
+ 
+     for (const importId of node.imports) {
+       if (!visited.has(importId)) {
+         dfs(importId, [...path])
+       } else if (recursionStack.has(importId)) {
+         // Found a cycle
+         const cycleStart = path.indexOf(importId)
+         const cycle = path.slice(cycleStart)
+         cycles.push(cycle)
+       }
+     }
+ 
+     recursionStack.delete(nodeId)
+   }
+ 
+   nodes.forEach((node) =&gt; {
+     if (!visited.has(node.id)) {
+       dfs(node.id, [])
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   return cycles
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper: Get color based on node type
+ function getNodeColor(type: string): string {
+   switch (type) {
+     case &#39;package&#39;:
+       return cyberpunkColors.neonMagenta
+     case &#39;module&#39;:
+       return cyberpunkColors.neonCyan
+     case &#39;file&#39;:
+       return cyberpunkColors.neonGreen
+     default:
+       return cyberpunkColors.neonBlue
+   }
+ }
+

+ /**
+  * 3D Contributor Activity Heatmap
+  * Volumetric rendering of contributor Ã— time Ã— file activity
+  */
+ 
+ import { useRef, useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { Text } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { cyberpunkColors } from &#39;../styles/cyberpunk-theme&#39;
+ 
+ interface ContributorActivity {
+   contributor: string
+   file: string
+   timestamp: number
+   linesChanged: number
+   commits: number
+ }
+ 
+ interface ContributorHeatmapProps {
+   activities: ContributorActivity[]
+   timeRange: [number, number]
+   onCellClick?: (activity: ContributorActivity) =&gt; void
+ }
+ 
+ export default function ContributorHeatmap3D({
+   activities,
+   timeRange,
+   onCellClick,
+ }: ContributorHeatmapProps) {
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+ 
+   // Aggregate data into grid
+   const heatmapData = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const contributors = Array.from(new Set(activities.map((a) =&gt; a.contributor)))
+     const files = Array.from(new Set(activities.map((a) =&gt; a.file)))
+     const timeSlots = 20 // Divide time range into 20 slots
+ 
+     const grid: Map&lt;string, number&gt; = new Map()
+ 
+     activities.forEach((activity) =&gt; {
+       const contribIndex = contributors.indexOf(activity.contributor)
+       const fileIndex = files.indexOf(activity.file)
+       const timeProgress = (activity.timestamp - timeRange[0]) / (timeRange[1] - timeRange[0])
+       const timeSlot = Math.floor(timeProgress * timeSlots)
+ 
+       const key = &#96;${contribIndex}-${fileIndex}-${timeSlot}&#96;
+       grid.set(key, (grid.get(key) || 0) + activity.linesChanged)
+     })
+ 
+     return { contributors, files, timeSlots, grid }
+   }, [activities, timeRange])
+ 
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (groupRef.current) {
+       // Gentle rotation for better viewing angle
+       groupRef.current.rotation.y = Math.sin(state.clock.elapsedTime * 0.2) * 0.3
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   const maxActivity = Math.max(...Array.from(heatmapData.grid.values()), 1)
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group ref={groupRef}&gt;
+       {/* Render volumetric cubes */}
+       {Array.from(heatmapData.grid.entries()).map(([key, activity]) =&gt; {
+         const [contribIndex, fileIndex, timeSlot] = key.split(&#39;-&#39;).map(Number)
+         
+         const x = contribIndex * 3
+         const y = fileIndex * 2
+         const z = timeSlot * 2.5
+ 
+         const intensity = activity / maxActivity
+         const height = intensity * 5
+         const color = getActivityColor(intensity)
+ 
+         return (
+           &lt;group key={key} position={[x, y, z]}&gt;
+             {/* Activity cube */}
+             &lt;mesh
+               position={[0, height / 2, 0]}
+               onClick={() =&gt; {
+                 const contrib = heatmapData.contributors[contribIndex]
+                 const file = heatmapData.files[fileIndex]
+                 const timestamp = timeRange[0] + (timeSlot / heatmapData.timeSlots) * (timeRange[1] - timeRange[0])
+                 onCellClick?.({ contributor: contrib, file, timestamp, linesChanged: activity, commits: 1 })
+               }}
+               onPointerOver={(e) =&gt; {
+                 e.stopPropagation()
+                 document.body.style.cursor = &#39;pointer&#39;
+               }}
+               onPointerOut={() =&gt; {
+                 document.body.style.cursor = &#39;default&#39;
+               }}
+             &gt;
+               &lt;boxGeometry args={[2, height, 2]} /&gt;
+               &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+                 color={color}
+                 emissive={color}
+                 emissiveIntensity={intensity * 2}
+                 transparent
+                 opacity={0.7 + intensity * 0.3}
+               /&gt;
+             &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+             {/* Glow effect for hot spots */}
+             {intensity &gt; 0.7 &amp;&amp; (
+               &lt;mesh position={[0, height / 2, 0]}&gt;
+                 &lt;boxGeometry args={[2.5, height + 1, 2.5]} /&gt;
+                 &lt;meshBasicMaterial
+                   color={color}
+                   transparent
+                   opacity={0.3}
+                   blending={THREE.AdditiveBlending}
+                 /&gt;
+               &lt;/mesh&gt;
+             )}
+           &lt;/group&gt;
+         )
+       })}
+ 
+       {/* Contributor axis labels */}
+       {heatmapData.contributors.map((contrib, i) =&gt; (
+         &lt;Text
+           key={&#96;contrib-${i}&#96;}
+           position={[i * 3, -2, -3]}
+           fontSize={0.4}
+           color={cyberpunkColors.neonCyan}
+           anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+           anchorY=&quot;middle&quot;
+           rotation={[-Math.PI / 6, 0, 0]}
+         &gt;
+           {contrib.split(&#39; &#39;)[0]}
+         &lt;/Text&gt;
+       ))}
+ 
+       {/* File axis labels */}
+       {heatmapData.files.slice(0, 10).map((file, i) =&gt; (
+         &lt;Text
+           key={&#96;file-${i}&#96;}
+           position={[-3, i * 2, -3]}
+           fontSize={0.3}
+           color={cyberpunkColors.neonMagenta}
+           anchorX=&quot;right&quot;
+           anchorY=&quot;middle&quot;
+         &gt;
+           {file.split(&#39;/&#39;).pop()?.substring(0, 20)}
+         &lt;/Text&gt;
+       ))}
+ 
+       {/* Time axis label */}
+       &lt;Text
+         position={[0, -5, heatmapData.timeSlots * 2.5 / 2]}
+         fontSize={0.5}
+         color={cyberpunkColors.neonGreen}
+         anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+         anchorY=&quot;middle&quot;
+       &gt;
+         Time â†’
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+ 
+       {/* Hotspot detection particles */}
+       &lt;Hotspots data={heatmapData} maxActivity={maxActivity} /&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Animated particles for activity hotspots
+ function Hotspots({
+   data,
+   maxActivity,
+ }: {
+   data: ReturnType&lt;typeof useMemo&lt;{
+     contributors: string[]
+     files: string[]
+     timeSlots: number
+     grid: Map&lt;string, number&gt;
+   }&gt;&gt;
+   maxActivity: number
+ }) {
+   const particlesRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Points&gt;(null)
+ 
+   const [positions, colors, sizes] = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const hotspots = Array.from(data.grid.entries())
+       .filter(([_, activity]) =&gt; activity / maxActivity &gt; 0.7)
+       .map(([key, activity]) =&gt; {
+         const [contribIndex, fileIndex, timeSlot] = key.split(&#39;-&#39;).map(Number)
+         return {
+           x: contribIndex * 3,
+           y: fileIndex * 2 + (activity / maxActivity) * 5 / 2,
+           z: timeSlot * 2.5,
+           intensity: activity / maxActivity,
+         }
+       })
+ 
+     const positions = new Float32Array(hotspots.length * 3)
+     const colors = new Float32Array(hotspots.length * 3)
+     const sizes = new Float32Array(hotspots.length)
+ 
+     hotspots.forEach((h, i) =&gt; {
+       positions[i * 3] = h.x
+       positions[i * 3 + 1] = h.y
+       positions[i * 3 + 2] = h.z
+ 
+       const color = new THREE.Color(cyberpunkColors.neonYellow)
+       colors[i * 3] = color.r
+       colors[i * 3 + 1] = color.g
+       colors[i * 3 + 2] = color.b
+ 
+       sizes[i] = h.intensity * 3
+     })
+ 
+     return [positions, colors, sizes]
+   }, [data, maxActivity])
+ 
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (particlesRef.current) {
+       // Floating animation
+       const positions = particlesRef.current.geometry.attributes.position.array as Float32Array
+       for (let i = 0; i &lt; positions.length; i += 3) {
+         positions[i + 1] += Math.sin(state.clock.elapsedTime * 2 + i) * 0.02
+       }
+       particlesRef.current.geometry.attributes.position.needsUpdate = true
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   if (positions.length === 0) return null
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;points ref={particlesRef}&gt;
+       &lt;bufferGeometry&gt;
+         &lt;bufferAttribute
+           attach=&quot;attributes-position&quot;
+           count={positions.length / 3}
+           array={positions}
+           itemSize={3}
+         /&gt;
+         &lt;bufferAttribute
+           attach=&quot;attributes-color&quot;
+           count={colors.length / 3}
+           array={colors}
+           itemSize={3}
+         /&gt;
+         &lt;bufferAttribute
+           attach=&quot;attributes-size&quot;
+           count={sizes.length}
+           array={sizes}
+           itemSize={1}
+         /&gt;
+       &lt;/bufferGeometry&gt;
+       &lt;pointsMaterial
+         vertexColors
+         transparent
+         opacity={0.8}
+         blending={THREE.AdditiveBlending}
+         sizeAttenuation
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/points&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper: Get activity intensity color
+ function getActivityColor(intensity: number): string {
+   if (intensity &gt; 0.8) return cyberpunkColors.error // Hot (red)
+   if (intensity &gt; 0.5) return cyberpunkColors.neonYellow // Warm (yellow)
+   if (intensity &gt; 0.2) return cyberpunkColors.neonGreen // Medium (green)
+   return cyberpunkColors.neonCyan // Cool (cyan)
+ }
+

+     const categories: Record&lt;Category, typeof shortcuts&gt; = {
+       view: shortcuts.filter((s) =&gt; s.action.startsWith(&#39;toggle-&#39;)),
+       navigation: shortcuts.filter((s) =&gt; 
+         s.action.includes(&#39;camera&#39;) ||

+   }, [])

+   // Filter shortcuts based on search and category
+   const filteredShortcuts = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     let filtered = shortcuts
+ 
+     if (selectedCategory !== &#39;all&#39;) {
+       filtered = categorizedShortcuts[selectedCategory]
+     }
+ 
+     if (searchQuery) {
+       const query = searchQuery.toLowerCase()
+       filtered = filtered.filter(

+           s.description.toLowerCase().includes(query) ||
+           s.action.toLowerCase().includes(query) ||
+           getShortcutDisplay(s).toLowerCase().includes(query)
+       )
+     }
+ 
+     return filtered
+   }, [searchQuery, selectedCategory, categorizedShortcuts])
